alert.note: Alert for Delta; Mesa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 3:46PM MST until February 22 at 4:30PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Delta County in west central Colorado... Southeastern Mesa County in west central Colorado... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 345 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Palisade to 18 miles southeast of Grand Junction to 21 miles west of Delta, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 48 and 72. Colorado 65 between mile markers 1 and 3. Colorado 92 between mile markers 1 and 3. Locations impacted include... Delta and Orchard City. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
